DescriptionOfIncident: P&B Foods recalls Heera Premium Quality Golden Sultanas because of undeclared sulphites
RiskToConsumers: Sulphites. These products contain sulphites, making them a possible health risk for anyone with a sensitivity to sulphur dioxide and/or sulphites.

DescriptionOfIncident: Co-op recalls Veg Taster because of undeclared fish
RiskToConsumers: Fish. This product contains fish making it a possible health risk for anyone with an allergy to fish.

DescriptionOfIncident: Windmill Organics recalls organic amisa lactose free rice milk chocolate rice cakes because of undeclared milk
RiskToConsumers: Milk. This product contains milk making it a possible health risk for anyone with an allergy or intolerance to milk or milk constituents.

DescriptionOfIncident: Leonidas boxed assortment of Belgian Chocolates may contain varieties with undeclared sesame seeds and nuts
RiskToConsumers: Sesame and nuts. These products may contain sesame and/or nuts, making them a possible health risk for anyone with an allergy to sesame and/or nuts.

DescriptionOfIncident: Tan Y Castell recalls its Chocolate Chip Griddles because they may contain milk which is not mentioned on the label
RiskToConsumers: Milk. This product may contain milk making it a possible health risk for anyone with an allergy or intolerance to milk or milk constituents.

DescriptionOfIncident: Flames Foods recalls various frozen products due to undeclared allergens
RiskToConsumers: egg, milk, mustard, nuts (almond), sesame, soya, sulphites, and wheat (gluten),. These products contain egg, milk, mustard, nuts (almond), sesame, soya, sulphites, and wheat (gluten), making them a possible health risk for anyone with allergy and/or intolerance to egg, and/or allergy and/or intolerance to milk or milk constituents, allergy to mustard, nuts (almond), sesame, soya, and/or a sensitivity to sulphur dioxide and/or sulphites, and/or allergy and/or intolerance to wheat (gluten).. . Please see attached PDF for the allergens in each affected product.

RiskToConsumers: Crustaceans. This product may contain prawns making it a possible health risk for anyone with an allergy to crustaceans.

RiskToConsumers: Milk. This product contains milk making it a possible health risk for anyone with an allergy or intolerance to milk or milk constituents.

DescriptionOfIncident: Lidl GB recalls SPEEDFEAST Quarter Pounder with Cheese because of incorrect allergen labelling
RiskToConsumers: Egg, milk and sesame. This product contains egg, milk and sesame making it a possible health risk for anyone with an allergy or intolerance to egg and/or milk or milk constituents and/or an allergy to sesame.

RiskToConsumers: Soya. This product contains soya, making it a possible health risk for anyone with an allergy to soya.

RiskToConsumers: Soya. These products contain soya making it a possible health risk for anyone with an allergy to soya.

RiskToConsumers: Mustard and Celery. This product contains mustard and celery making it a possible health risk for anyone with an allergy to celery and/or an allergy to mustard.

RiskToConsumers: Nuts (Almond). These products may contain nuts (almond) making them a possible health risk for anyone with an allergy to nuts.

RiskToConsumers: Wheat (gluten). This product contains wheat making it a possible health risk for anyone with an allergy or intolerance to wheat or gluten.

RiskToConsumers: Milk. This product may contain milk making it a possible health risk for anyone with an allergy or intolerance to milk or milk constituents.

DescriptionOfIncident: Lidl Northern Ireland recalls three products as the allergens are not in English
RiskToConsumers: The above products contain milk, wheat and egg, which have not been mentioned on the label. This makes the product unsafe for anyone with an allergy or intolerance to milk or its constituents, an allergy or intolerance to wheat or gluten and/or an allergy or intolerance to egg.
